categories.name: Sushi Roll Call: Ingredients and Origins

questions.clue: This popular sushi roll, named after a U.S. state, typically includes crab, avocado, and cucumber.
Named for its fiery color, this roll often combines spicy tuna with cucumber and is sometimes topped with more tuna or spicy mayo.
This roll, named after a European capital, features salmon, cream cheese, and cucumber, and is sometimes topped with smoked salmon.
Also known as the 'inside-out' roll, this sushi features rice on the outside and can include ingredients like avocado and fish roe.
This roll, named after a mythical creature, includes ingredients like eel, cucumber, and avocado, often topped with thin slices of avocado and eel sauce.
This popular sushi ingredient is also known as a 'tuna' and can weigh up to 1,500 pounds.
Often used in sushi, this type of seaweed is also known as 'nori' and is rich in vitamins and minerals.
This ocean zone, also called the 'twilight zone', is where sunlight starts to fade, and some sushi ingredients like squid live.
Known for its taste and used in sushi, this eel species is also called 'unagi' in Japanese cuisine.
This deep-sea creature, a relative of the octopus, is known for its ability to change color and is a delicacy in sushi as 'tako'.

categories.name: Literary Landmarks: Famous Books and Their Settings

questions.clue: In this classic by J.D. Salinger, Holden Caulfield narrates his experiences in and around Manhattan.
F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel set in the fictional towns of West Egg and East Egg explores the Jazz Age on Long Island.
Harper Lee's novel set in the fictional town of Maycomb deals with racial injustice in the Deep South.
This novel by George Orwell depicts a dystopian future where Big Brother watches over the citizens of Airstrip One.
In James Joyce's groundbreaking work, the city of Dublin serves as the backdrop for the various episodes of this 1922 novel.

categories.name: Mathematical Marvels: The World of Numbers

questions.clue: This number is the only even prime number and is essential for dividing a sushi roll evenly between two people.
When ordering sushi, this term for the square root of 100 might remind you of a century of sushi dinners.
The number of pieces in a standard sushi roll often matches this triangular number, which is the sum of the first three positive integers.
This irrational number, approximately 1.618, is known as the golden ratio and can be found in the natural spiral of a sushi roll's seaweed wrap.
In sushi mathematics, this series starting at 0 and 1, where each number is the sum of the two preceding ones, might model the perfect sushi chef's sequence of past experiences.

categories.name: Ancient Civilizations: Lost Cities and Cultures

questions.clue: For $200: This city, known for its legendary walls, was the site of a famous war chronicled by Homer.
For $400: The Minoan civilization centered on this island's city of Knossos, famous for the Minotaur legend.
For $600: This ancient city in present-day Iraq was famous for its ziggurat and was part of the Sumerian civilization.
For $800: Once a thriving Maya city, this site in modern Guatemala is known for its impressive pyramids and was rediscovered in the 1840s.
For $1000: Known for its advanced hydraulic engineering, this lost civilization in the Indus Valley had major cities like Mohenjo-daro.

final.clue: Originally a method of preserving fish in fermented rice, this dish's name translates to 'sour-tasting' in Japanese, reflecting its origins.
